revised_title: Observations on the Parallax of a Lyrae and Refraction Formula
tldr: The author, John Brinkley, conducted observations on the star a Lyrae to determine its annual parallax. He found a parallax of 2°52' and concluded that his eight-foot circle was a valuable tool in astronomy. Additionally, he proposed a slight alteration to Dr. Bradley's refraction formula based on his observations of different circumpolar stars.
